name: Masqueradeball
description:
Welcome to Masqueradeball!

Challenge a friend to a spooky session of sports and surprises.

Featuring art by James King.

I recommend that you play in full screen. Please don't resize the window after the title screen.

Controls
  • The game uses analogue movement and one button. Gamepads are recommended.
  • Move with the analogue sticks, unmask and use special abilities with a face button. Stop moving to shoot.
  • You can use the arrow or WASD keys and space bar/enter instead.
  • The game requires two input devices (you can't share gamepads or keyboards, sorry).
What is this?

This is a functional but very unfinished prototype.

This is a small game I've been developing over the past month. I hope you find it fun! Please try it for free and see if you like it.

The reason I'm releasing it in this state is because tomorrow I start a new job that won't allow me to publish games in my spare time.

Can you give me any strategy tips?

Unmasking is a powerful move that will instantly give you possession of the ball if it's nearby. Save it for the opportune moment!

Anything else I should know?

Contains cartoon spiders and undead.
